briefdescription.para: Pointer to the next Drawable.

detaileddescription.para: Maintained by containers.

briefdescription.para: Pointer to this drawable's parent.
The coordinates of this Drawable, relative to its parent.
True if this drawable should receive touch events.
True if this drawable should be drawn.
This function can be called on parent nodes to signal that the size or position of one or more of its children has changed.

detaileddescription.para: Currently only used in ScrollableContainer to redraw scrollbars when the size of the scrolling contents changes.

briefdescription.para: Draw this drawable.

detaileddescription.para: It is a requirement that the draw implementation does not draw outside the region specified by invalidatedArea.

parameterdescription.para: The sub-region of this drawable that needs to be redrawn, expressed in coordinates relative to its parent (e.g. for a complete redraw, invalidatedArea will be (0, 0, width, height).

briefdescription.para: Initializes a new instance of the Drawable class.
Render the Drawable object into a dynamic bitmap.

parameterdescription.para: The target dynamic bitmap to use for rendering.

briefdescription.para: Helper function for obtaining the rectangle this Drawable covers, expressed in absolute coordinates.

simplesect.para: The rectangle this Drawable covers expressed in absolute coordinates.
getRect, translateRectToAbsolute

briefdescription.para: Gets the height of this Drawable.

simplesect.para: The height of this Drawable.

briefdescription.para: Function for obtaining the the last child of this drawable that intersects with the specified point.

detaileddescription.para: The last child is the Drawable that is drawn last and therefore the topmost child. Used in input event handling for obtaining the appropriate drawable that should receive the event.

parameterdescription.para: The point of intersection expressed in coordinates relative to the parent.
The point of intersection expressed in coordinates relative to the parent.
Last (topmost) Drawable on the given coordinate.

simplesect.para: Input events must be delegated to the last drawable of the tree (meaning highest z- order / front-most drawable).

briefdescription.para: Gets the next sibling node.

detaileddescription.para: This will be the next Drawable that has been added to the same Container as this Drawable.

simplesect.para: The next sibling. If there are no more siblings, the return value is 0.

briefdescription.para: Returns the parent node.

detaileddescription.para: For the root container, the return value is 0.

simplesect.para: The parent node. For the root container, the return value is 0.
A disconnected Drawable also has parent 0 which may cause strange side effects.

briefdescription.para: Gets the rectangle this Drawable covers, in coordinates relative to its parent.

simplesect.para: The rectangle this Drawable covers expressed in coordinates relative to its parent.

briefdescription.para: Get (the largest possible) rectangle that is guaranteed to be solid (opaque).

detaileddescription.para: This information is important, as any Drawable underneath the solid area does not need to be drawn.

simplesect.para: The solid rectangle part of the Drawable.

The rectangle returned must be relative to upper left corner of the Drawable, meaning that a completely solid widget should return the full size Rect(0, 0, getWidth(), getHeight()). If no area can be guaranteed to be solid, an empty Rect(0, 0, 0, 0) must be returned. Failing to return the correct rectangle may result in errors on the display.

briefdescription.para: Helper function for obtaining the largest solid rect (as implemented by getSolidRect()) expressed in absolute coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: Will recursively traverse to the root of the tree to find the proper location of the rectangle on the display.

simplesect.para: The (largest) solid rect (as implemented by getSolidRect()) expressed in absolute coordinates.

briefdescription.para: Function for finding the visible part of this drawable.

detaileddescription.para: If the parent node has a smaller area than this Drawable, or if the Drawable is placed "over the edge" of the parent, the parent will act as a view port, cutting off the parts of this Drawable that are outside the region. Traverses the tree and yields a result expressed in absolute coordinates.

parameterdescription.para: The region of the Drawable that is visible.

briefdescription.para: Gets the width of this Drawable.

simplesect.para: The width of this Drawable.

briefdescription.para: Gets the x coordinate of this Drawable, relative to its parent.

simplesect.para: The x value, relative to the parent.

briefdescription.para: Gets the y coordinate of this Drawable, relative to its parent.

simplesect.para: The y value, relative to the parent.

briefdescription.para: Defines the event handler interface for ClickEvents.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation ignores the event. The event is only received if the Drawable is touchable and visible.

parameterdescription.para: The ClickEvent received from the HAL.

briefdescription.para: Defines the event handler interface for DragEvents.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation ignores the event. The event is only received if the drawable is touchable and visible.

parameterdescription.para: The DragEvent received from the HAL.

briefdescription.para: Defines the event handler interface for GestureEvents.

detaileddescription.para: The default implementation ignores the event. The event is only received if the Drawable is touchable and visible.

parameterdescription.para: The GestureEvent received from the HAL.

briefdescription.para: Called periodically by the framework if the Drawable instance has subscribed to timer ticks.
Tell the framework that this entire Drawable needs to be redrawn.

detaileddescription.para: It is the same as calling invalidateRect() with Rect(0, 0, getWidth(), getHeight()).

briefdescription.para: Request that a region of this drawable is redrawn.

detaileddescription.para: Will recursively traverse the tree towards the root, and once reached, issue a draw operation. When this function returns, the specified invalidated area has been redrawn for all appropriate Drawables covering the region.
To invalidate the entire Drawable, use invalidate()

parameterdescription.para: The area of this drawable to redraw expressed in relative coordinates.

briefdescription.para: Gets whether this Drawable receives touch events or not.

simplesect.para: True if touch events are received.

briefdescription.para: Gets whether this Drawable is visible.

simplesect.para: true if the Drawable is visible.

briefdescription.para: Moves the drawable.

parameterdescription.para: The relative position to move to.
The relative position to move to.

simplesect.para: moveTo, setXY
Will redraw the appropriate areas of the screen.

briefdescription.para: Moves the drawable.

parameterdescription.para: The absolute position to move to.
The absolute position to move to.

simplesect.para: moveRelative, setXY
Will redraw the appropriate areas of the screen.

briefdescription.para: Sets the height of this drawable.

parameterdescription.para: The new height.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.

memberdef.argsstring: (int16_t x, int16_t y, int16_t width, int16_t height)
memberdef.name: setPosition

briefdescription.para: Sets the size and position of this Drawable, relative to its parent.

detaileddescription.para: The same as calling setXY(), setWidth() and setHeight() in that order.

parameterdescription.para: The x coordinate of this Drawable relative to its parent.
The y coordinate of this Drawable relative to its parent.
The width of this Drawable.
The height of this Drawable.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.

briefdescription.para: Controls whether this Drawable receives touch events or not.

parameterdescription.para: If true it will receive touch events, if false it will not.

briefdescription.para: Controls whether this Drawable should be visible.

detaileddescription.para: Only visible Drawables will have their draw function called. Additionally, invisible drawables will not receive input events.

parameterdescription.para: true if this Drawable should be visible. By default, drawables are visible unless this function has been called with false as argument.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.

briefdescription.para: Sets the width of this drawable.

parameterdescription.para: The new width.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.

briefdescription.para: Sets the x coordinate of this Drawable, relative to its parent.

parameterdescription.para: The new x value, relative to the parent. A negative value is allowed.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.

briefdescription.para: Sets the x and y coordinates of this Drawable, relative to its parent.

detaileddescription.para: The same as calling setX() followed by calling setY().

parameterdescription.para: The new x value, relative to the parent. A negative value is allowed.
The new y value, relative to the parent. A negative value is allowed.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.

briefdescription.para: Sets the y coordinate of this Drawable, relative to its parent.

parameterdescription.para: The new y value, relative to the parent. A negative value is allowed.

simplesect.para: For most Drawable widgets, changing this does normally not automatically yield a redraw.

briefdescription.para: Helper function for converting a region of this Drawable to absolute coordinates.

parameterdescription.para: The Rect to translate.

briefdescription.para: Finalizes an instance of the Drawable class.
The Drawable class is an abstract definition of something that can be drawn.

detaileddescription.para: In the composite design pattern, the Drawable is the component interface. Drawables can be added to a screen as a tree structure through the leaf node class Widget and the Container class. A Drawable contains a pointer to its next sibling and a pointer to its parent node. These are maintained by the Container to which the Drawable is added.

The Drawable interface contains two pure virtual functions which must be implemented by widgets, namely draw() and getSolidRect(). In addition it contains general functionality for receiving events and navigating the tree structure.
The coordinates of a Drawable are always relative to its parent node.

simplesect.para: Widget, Container
